images.caption: Figure 1.Request length distributions and arrival patterns for different task types in QwenTrace(Wanget al.,2025). We explore the possibility of scheduling requests with diverse SLO guarantees.
Figure 2.Using different prefill granularities to meet the SLO of time-to-first-token.
Figure 3.Throughput and latency of chunked prefill for a 32K-token input under different chunk sizes when serving an Llama3-8B. Alternating colors within each bar demarcate individual chunks.
Figure 4.Throughput and normalized TTFT during the prefill phase for different input lengths when serving an Llama3-8B.

Figure 6.Execution logic is hierarchical, and preemption checks can be placed at different execution boundaries. Preemption checks at the chunk or layer level result in coarser preemption granularity, whereas FlowPrefill places them at core operator boundaries for the finest-grained preemption. (Blue circles denote preemption checks.)
Figure 8.Example of serving two requests with different priorities in FlowPrefill.
Figure 9.End-to-end performance of three models under varying request rates and SLO requirements on QwenTrace.
Figure 10.Performance comparison under three scheduling policies.
Figure 11.Performance comparison under varying batch token budgets and no batching.

Figure 12.Average preemption blocking time under operator- and layer-level preemption boundaries. Different preemption granularities are realized by placing preemption checks at different execution boundaries.
Figure 13.Real and predicted TTFT for three models serving a trace segment from QwenTrace at a given request rate.

Figure 14.Performance comparison under a single-SLO workload. FlowPrefill matches baseline throughput, indicating negligible operator-level preemption (ยง5.1) overhead but delivers better SLO attainment as request rates scale.
Figure 15.Performance of FlowPrefill with chunked prefill under different chunk sizes.
Figure 16.Performance comparison under the PD-colocation setting across varying request rates, reporting TTFT and TBT SLO attainment.
